title: Bug Report -'Mark' bug on ARAM

embed.description: Playing a game of League today, and had an event occur... -- Recorded with NVIDIA ShadowPlay, encoded with Handbrake

body:
So, playing ARAM today, I had a match where, as Maokai, I "Marked" ({{summoner:31}} ) an enemy Sion as he was coming back to life, then flew across the map to their platform / alter, promptly giving the enemy team a kill. From this, we can establish that the revive order is:
1) Make them targetable
2) Restore the Champion to full hp / Set them to alive
3) "Teleport" them to their starting position
Parts 1 and 2 perhaps being one step combined.

Because of this, it is possible to Mark them as they come back to life, meaning you're going to have a bad time by jumping to them.

Even though the odds of this happening are astronomical, it may be necessary to rework it to 
1) Teleport the body to the start position
2) Restore their HP
3) Make them targetable


Not that it's necessary, but match history = [(http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/88455632/200033242)]

replies.body: Reposts won't make it more noticed.
Yeah, I know. Complete accident. I posted (for the first time) and didn't see it appear at the top of the list.
